data.title: Fixes D2K not finding paratrooper shadow sequence
data.body:
Fixes regression from #8339

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8339/files#r34637358

The engine wasn't able to locate the sequence. I haven't gone deeply into it, but it seems all sequences in d2k/sequences/misc.yaml specify the exact file where the sequence resides...

data.title: Rename Country to Faction in Player.cs
data.body:
Yet another piece of #7873.
Split into nice small commits for easy reviewing.

data.title: Some work on the missile projectile
data.body:
An attempt at tackling #7509.

Introduces:
- vertical rate of turn
- customizable vertical launch angle
- delayed activation of the homing mechanism / propulsion
- freefall while propulsion deactivated
- customizable explosion altitude (for airburst)
- customizable cruise altitude (when target out of range)
- height checks for terrain impact and shadow rendering
- acceleration (instead of constant speed from launch to impact)

Not sure about what was meant in #7509 by
- proper 3D math

Still missing and out of scope of this PR (at least currently)
- support for voxel artwork

data.title: Explicitly set current working directory
data.body:
Fixes #8592.

Steps to reproduce (**on Windows**):
 **1.** Open http://www.openra.net/games/ and click on a game IP to launch OpenRA.
 **2.** Chances are you won't connect due to version mismatch (most servers run the release and your playtest installer will have overwritten the registry, so the playtest version should run). Doesn't matter.
 **3.** Connected or not, go to the modchooser.
 **4.** You will get a nice exception:

> Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: File not found: ./mods/modchooser/chrome.png

 **5.** Build OpenRA with the provided patch and replace the playtest's exe (`OpenRA.exe`).
**6.** Repeat steps **1**-**3**. Now you should be able to switch mods at will.

**P.S.:** Or use the installer @obrakmann provided in #8592.

data.title: Remove OwnerRow from explosive barrels
data.body: Also removed the OwnerRow from the soviet prison in allies05a.

data.title: Spy veterancy leftovers
data.body:
Fixes regression from #8210 (RANK+1 displayed for every experience increase instead of only on level increments).

Disables levelup thru war factory spy infiltration in Allies05 (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8210#issuecomment-117320639)

Sorry bout missing these in #8210

data.title: Fixes Empty filter in server browser.
data.body:
Currently, the Empty filter in server browser doesn't work. Waiting covers empty servers too, so when only Empty is selected, nothing is shown. Deselecting Waiting shouldn't filter out empty servers.

I haven't tested this code but when only Empty is checked, it should show servers with zero players.

data.title: Rename ProduceableWithLevel to ProducibleWithLevel.
ResourceType.MinDensityToHarvest
data.body:
This isn't really the effect I wanted but works well enough so I figured we could use it.

What I'd like to do is set and use this value on a per-cell resource instance basis.
If we'd rather have that and anyone has pointers, please let me know.

data.title: Implements victory and defeat music.
data.body:
Followup of #8562.

Due to map loading themes became useless to us, I repurposed them into defeat music at the RA, D2K and the TS mod. In C&C, GDI and Nod had separate loadthemes, so I repurposed the Nod one.
I also changed the D2K shellmap to use the network theme instead of the score track.

The first commit is the logic, the second commit might need it's own PR, because the Nod victory/map themes were unlisted previously alongside three other tracks.

data.title: Removes force start and auto start from lobby.
data.body:
Instead of #8705. I think this way it is clearer and simpler.
- No auto start. Host has to manually click Start Game button.
- No force start. Start Game button is disabled if not all players are ready.

data.title: Improved caching in harvester activities
data.body:
Also made delay between attempts to link to a refinery customisable and and some cosmetic cleanups to `Harvester` and `BasePathSearch`.

Split from #8622.

data.title: One spy should affect one building and only one
data.body:
It's a bit odd to be able to shut the power down in an entire base with only one spy.
A spy in an advanced power plant should block this power plant only, so the player has temporarily 200 less energy.
Doing this, a player attacked with spies can handle them by managing his power and a player attacking with spies has a bit more to do to stop an entire base than moving around only one $ 250 guy.

data.title: Support powers statistics
data.body: Can you add the number of ~~superweapons~~ support powers used in the statistics ?

data.title: Removes "Start Game" button from lobby.
data.body: Now only ready checkboxes determine game start. Also adds ready checkboxes to spectators.

data.title: Require trait properties in MiniYaml
data.body:
Allows for marking certain trait properties as required using `[FieldLoader.Require]` or `[FieldLoader.LoadUsing("...", true)]`.

Based on comment from @Phrohdoh on #8698.

To test, just comment out one of the required trait properties.

data.title: Adds a restart button for single player games.
data.body:
Not finished. I opened this to get some feedback on the code.

Closes #4874. Depends on  #8105.

Adds a restart button to ingame menu for single player games. Currently it works for missions but crashes for skirmish games because of a replay connection problem. Here's the exception message:

```

   at System.IO.BinaryWriter.Write(Int32 value)

   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn) in d:\Dev\openra_dev\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Network\ReplayRecorderConnection.cs:line 81
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate() in d:\Dev\openra_dev\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Network\OrderManager.cs:line 112

   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) in d:\Dev\openra_dev\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 463
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() in d:\Dev\openra_dev\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 510
```

How can I fix this?

data.title: Fix an NRE during building placement under rare circumstances
data.body: Fixes #8591.

data.title: Renames "Disable Shroud & Fog" debug option to "Observer view".
data.body: Because it sets RenderPlayer to null which affects more than shroud and fog.

data.title: Shows real owner of disguised units to allies.
data.body:
Continuation of #8298.

I changed the code. If disable shroud cheat should actually give the player observer view, then it is enough to only check for RenderPlayer as ally. I think then that debug option should be renamed to "Get observer view" or similar. Also, then it is much simpler than how I was trying to do it. No need for shared method to get current player...

This PR does the following:
- In tooltip, shows the real owner of disguised units to allies. Now it matches their radar color. Previously it was shown only to the owner.
- Corrects some comments.

data.title: Make GainsExperience upgrades explicit in MiniYaml.
data.body: Applies a similar policy as requested in comments for #8572 to GainsExperience.

data.title: Made all body, turret and barrel render traits upgradable
data.body:
Another milestone towards implementing TS deployed units (artillery, tick tank etc.) via `DeployToUpgrade`.

Allows actors to change appearance on upgrade/levelup too, of course.

data.title: TD: difficulty selection dropdown should show selection
data.body:
currently you have to click on it and open it to see which difficulty is selected
changing this to show something like "Difficulty: Easy" would improve usability

![difficulty](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10729559/8605500/0c5b8264-2686-11e5-977f-bfed16ca817a.png)

data.title: Added a map coordinates overlay for the editor
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7750.

data.title: Add different difficulties for allies02
data.body:
Not sure about `Real tough guy` though, as you don't get a `mcv` there.
Maybe get it at the end or after the convoy approached? Or is it good as is? Opinions welcome. ;)

data.title: Move silo from defense to building queue
data.body:
Love the game. I cannot stand the fact that the silos are in the defence category! Can someone convince me why that makes sense?

Cheers,

Ben

data.title: Renamed WRange to WDist in the Lua API and documentation
data.body: A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8667.

data.title: Updated SDL2-CS to use current upstream version
data.body: This shouldn't change much other than our version being re-united with upstream again which is better in terms of maintenance and collaboration. See https://github.com/OpenRA/SDL2-CS/compare/openra...OpenRA:minitk for a changelog.
